title: A multimodal intervention for Alzheimer's disease results in multifaceted systemic effects reflected in blood and ameliorates functional and cognitive outcomes
authors: J. Roach; L. Edens; D. R. Markewych; M. Rapozo; J. Hara; Gustavo Glusman; C. Funk; J. Bramen; P. Baloni; W. Shankle; L. Hood

title: Brain and systemic inflammation in de novo Parkinson's disease
brief: 18F-DPA-714 imaging demonstrated increased central inflammation in de novo PD subjects compared to controls, and longitudinal follow-up will be important to determine whether the presence of inflammation predicts cognitive decline.
authors: T. Yacoubian; Yaxiu Fang; A. Gerstenecker; A. Amara; N. Stover; L. Ruffrage; C. Collete; R. Kennedy; Y. Zhang; H. Hong; H. Qin; J. McConathy; E. Benveniste; D. Standaert

title: Neurodegenerative disease associated pathways in brain of the triple transgenic Alzheimer’s model are reversed in vivo following two weeks peripheral administration of fasudil
brief: The results bolster the repurposing potential of fasudil by demonstrating an anti-neurodegenerative phenotype in a disease context and highlight the potential of in vivo transcriptional profiling of drug activity.
authors: R. Killick; C. Elliott; E. Ribe; M. Broadstock; C. Ballard; D. Aarsland; Gareth Williams

title: Targeting neuroinflammatory pathways using Nanoligomers™ is neuroprotective in prion disease
brief: Critically, the Nanoligomer™ protected the brain from prion-induced spongiotic change, neuronal loss, and significantly increased life span, indicating that Nanolgomer™ inhibition of inflammatory pathways can prevent neuronal death and slow the progression of neurodegenerative diseases.
authors: Sydney J. Risen; Sean Boland; Sadhana Sharma; Grace Weismann; Payton Shirley; Amelia D. Hines; Arielle J. D. Hay; Vincenzo S Gilberto; S. McGrath; A. Chatterjee; P. Nagpal; J. Moreno

title: Naturally occurring Alzheimer’s disease in rhesus monkeys
authors: Zhenhui Li; Xiaping He; Shihao Wu; Rongyao Huang; Hao Li; Zhengbo Wang; Limin Wang; Dongdong Qin; Yu Kong; Yingqi Guo; Xia Ma; C. Turck; Zhiqi Xiong; Wenchao Wang; Xintian Hu

title: Age-specific activation of microglial genes in a mouse model of AD
Small-molecule ketone esters treat brain network abnormalities in an Alzheimer’s disease mouse model
brief: Small molecule ketone esters were developed to deliver ketone bodies pharmacologically to identify the specific mechanism of the pleiotropic ketogenic diet and resulted in cognitive improvement and in a sex-stratified analysis also improved survival in the more severely affected hAPPJ20 males.
authors: John C Newman; K. Ma; François Kroll; E. Higgins; S. Ulrich; J. Palop; E. Verdin

title: The genetic overlap between Alzheimer's disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, Lewy body dementia, and Parkinson's disease
brief: This study aimed to identify overlap between the four investigated neurodegenerative disorders at the variant, gene, genomic locus, gene-set, cell, or tissue level, with specific interest in overlap between three or more diseases.
authors: D. Wightman; J. Savage; E. Tissink; C. Romero; I. Jansen; D. Posthuma

title: A non-human primate model with Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology induced by hippocampal overexpression of human tau
authors: Zhouquan Jiang; Jing Wang; Bin Luo; F.X. Bai; Yongpeng Qin; Huiyi Wei; Shaojuan Zhang; Junjie Wei; Guoyu Ding; Long Ma; S. He; Rongjie Chen; Lu Wang; Hao Xu; Xiangyu Wang; Gong Chen; Wenliang Lei

title: Distinct and joint effects of low and high levels of AÎ² and tau deposition on cortical thickness
brief: It is confirmed that prior findings of an association between A{beta} deposition and cortical thickening and suggest this may also be the case in the earliest stages of deposition in normal aging and illustrated that resonance between high levels of A{ beta} and tau uptake is strongly associated with cortical thinning.
authors: S. H. Hojjati; T. Butler; G. Chiang; C. Habeck; A. Roychoudhury; F. Feiz; J. Shteingart; S. Nayak; S. Ozoria; A. Fernández; Y. Stern; J. Luchsinger; D. Devanand; Q. Razlighi

title: Association of Women-Specific Health Factors in the Severity of Parkinson's Disease
brief: This study is the first nationally available questionnaire for women's health and PD, and shifts the paradigm in understanding PD etiology and acknowledging how sex-specific experiences may contribute to PD severity.
authors: S. Rao; Y. Li; B. Lapin; S. Pattipati; K. Ghosh Galvelis; A. Naito; N. Gutierrez; T. Peixoto Leal; A. Salim; P. Salles; M. D. De Leon; I. Mata

title: Natural language processing and modeling of clinical disease trajectories across brain disorders
brief: A computational pipeline to process clinical summaries from donors with a wide range of brain disorders that were neuro-pathologically diagnosed by the Netherlands Brain Bank is established, resulting in a highly unique resource that can facilitate research into cross-disorder symptomatology.
authors: N. Mekkes; M. Groot; S. Wehrens; E. J. Hoekstra; M. Herbert; M. Brummer; D. Wever; Netherlands Neurogenetics Database consortium; A. Rozenmuller; I. Huitinga; I. Holtman

title: Menopause, Brain Anatomy, Cognition and Alzheimer’s Disease
brief: It is confirmed that both early and surgical menopause are associated with a higher risk of developing AD, indicating that early and abrupt ovarian hormone deprivation might contribute to the development of the disorder.
authors: M. Costantino; Grace Pigeau; Olivier Parent; Justine Ziolkowski; Gabriel A. Devenyi; N. Gervais; M. Mallar Chakravarty

title: Biological aging of human body and brain systems
brief: It is found that an organ's biological age selectively influences the aging of other organ systems, revealing a multiorgan aging network and revealing the multisystem nature of human aging.
authors: Y. Tian; V. Cropley; A. Maier; N. Lautenschlager; M. Breakspear; A. Zalesky

title: Literature-based predictions of treatments for genetic disease pathology
brief: This publicly available tool provides an automated way to prioritize drug screens to target the most-promising drugs to test, thereby saving time and resources in the development of therapeutics for genetic disorders.
authors: C. A. Deisseroth; Won-Seok Lee; Ji-Yoen Kim; Hyun-hwan Jeong; Julia Wang; H. Zoghbi; Zhandong Liu
